item.title: Mount a FTP site from fstab
item.description: I still have clients or websites where the most convenient (middle ages based) method of exchanging files is FTP. Since I’m lazy by nature I don’t like firing up a FTP client, I’d prefer to just have it available on request. For a while the KDE Network Places did the trick. But I decided I want it even easier. Behold curlftpfs. One sbopkg -ki curlftpfs (replace that with apt-get, yum or compile from source depending on your distro) later and I could do this in fstab:
